website_summaries.verdict: Bright LED lighting for the tail lights at an affordable price.
pros: Kit includes everything you will need to put lights on your trailer
cons: While the tail lights are LED, the side lights for this are still incandescent

customer_reviews.title: Wiring that comes with the kit TURNS TO POWDER
customer_reviews.text: The wiring that came with the kit is substandard to say the least, after less than a year in service they turned to powder and can be pulled apart by hand. As an electrical engineer I've worked around wiring for over 15 years and I've never seen something like this. Video attached. Lights themselves are still working just fine, so there is that, and the light leads do not seem to be the same substandard wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Link

customer_reviews.title: Well crap!
customer_reviews.text: Installed it today and took me waaaaaaaay to much time to troubleshoot, everything was grounded and wired correctly, checked current. All good... Yet my back left tail light(running) is dimmer than the one on the right and small left side tail light and license plate light don't work. I don't understand what's going on... Pissed me off. Here are photos...
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline T.

customer_reviews.title: Good for one year
customer_reviews.text: 13 months after installing the harness literally fell apart from corrosion. Put these on a steel utility trailer that is stored outside under a tarp in the south. Last used a couple months ago then hooked up and not working. Looked under the trailer and tugged a little on one wire and it just crumbled. Inspecting the rest showed the same- it was like dust when touched and fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: jAndrew

customer_reviews.title: Very good trailer light set
customer_reviews.text: DOT approved, so highway legal. The red side lights are LED now (July 2019), if they were not LED before, as highlighted by another reviewer. The wiring provided is maybe 18 gauge, in any event thicker than other light kits I have used, which is good. These are claimed to be submersible, and the LEDs and their driver boards may indeed be sealed, but the housings are definitely not sealed against water entry. This may be by design, so there is no buoyancy effect, but water can go in and drain out of the housings. To be safe, I mount the taillights with wingnuts and pull-apart electrical connectors, and remove the taillights before backing my boat trailer into the water.
customer_reviews.author: Arisaka38

customer_reviews.title: So Nice, We Bought Them Twice.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these lights because my husband was tired of his older lights flickering when he hit a bump or what not. Read a bunch of reviews and viewed a bunch of products. We decided on these. Seemed like a nice kit for the price. Got the box, everything came as it said it would. Was easy to install on the truck and trailer and they have been working great ever since. So it was only natural that when we purchased a second trailer, we came right back here and clicked ORDER AGAIN. They came again, just as they should, installed nicely and have been working ever since. Would definitely recommend this product. Wouldn't hesitate to order again. (which I did)
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: NOT SUBMERSIBLE. GARBAGE WIRING.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are listed here as being submersible, however, the paperwork that came with them says otherwise. Upon further inspection, there's no kind of gasket that would be present in a typical set of submersible lights. When pulling a trailer down the road on a rainy day, we found the license plate light had water in it. The wiring in them was faulty, lights would blink when hitting any kind of bumps (other trailer lights work fine, so we knew the issue was with the lights and not on our end) Save yourself the money. Especially if you need something submersible, because these lights are DEFINITELY NOT submersible.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Significantly Better Quality than Others
customer_reviews.text: This is important: this light kit is a significant step up in quality from some less expensive kits, with separate ground wires and increased brightness.. Built my own kayak trailer based on a Northern Tools kit. After trying 3 other kits (original set, a Northern Tools replacement set, and a Wally-World set,) this is the only kit to have separate ground wires. The other kits have a thin metal shim off the mounting brackets that is supposed to act as a ground. Lack of a solid ground on the cheap kits caused trailer light failure with three vehicles. The LEDs are noticeably brighter than bulbs. The better quality of this kit is worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Dickson

customer_reviews.title: (note photos) The wiring is of such poor quality that it has basically turned to powder inside ...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, purchased this in 2016, had light trouble and found the source, (note photos) The wiring is of such poor quality that it has basically turned to powder inside the insulation. Not sure what it is made of, but it looks like cheap aluminum with a copper coating. Checked in several places and the same condition was observed. So the issue with non-working taillights is due to resistance. The current can't travel through all of the oxidized and pulverized wiring. Unbelievably poor quality! Now I have to go out and purchase some quality wire and invest the labor hours to rewire the trailer after 19 months.
customer_reviews.author: Broomhilda16

customer_reviews.title: turned to dust
customer_reviews.text: these were good for my first season using them. 2020, i hookup to my truck - no lights.. go to check wire nut connection, just touching the wires caused the wire to break. no worries! grabbed my cutter/crimpers thinking id strip it back and re connect it. nope. the insulation has dry rotted considerably AND the wires themselves were basically dust. trying to strip back the insulation just broke the wire every time. finally got some stripped back, connected them and the lights were very dim - more than likely from corroded wires causing a lot of resistance. nope. get something marine grade.
customer_reviews.author: John Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Incredible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I wired these as additional brake/running/turn lights as the ones built on my trailer are very low to the ground and hard to see. The new lights work great as running lights but neither the brake nor turn signal functions work (hence 3 stars unless it's my fault). Checked all wiring and there are no short circuits, etc. The original lights work in all respects. Could it be that I'm overloading the system? I didn't expect that as they are LED and thus low power draw. UPDATE: Upgraded to 4 stars because their customer service has been amazing in walking me through the testing procedure, etc. I'm sure it's something I did wrong!
customer_reviews.author: PAHunter

customer_reviews.title: Great set! Great value
customer_reviews.text: Water proof and comes with everything that you need. The trailer wiring isn’t great on the wire bundle- fair warning. It’s flimsy and it broke. The lights are truly waterproof and have lasted over 2 years already through multiple boat launches, rain, snow, and stored outside. The wire attached to the actual lights fortunately is of better and more durable quality. Good thing my trailer was already pre-wired! The LEDs are very responsive and bright - much better than halogens. I’d highly recommend this set overall - just hope you already have existing trailer wire, and if not buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement and upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used jet ski trailer to haul my kayaks and the old lights on the trailer were trashed! I bought these lights one evening and they were delivered the next day. It took about an hour to install them but I hid the wiring in the frame instead of just zip tying them to the frame. Pay attention to properly grounding your lights. I went back and grounded the white wires directly to the trailer using screws instead of relying on the mounting studs with the trailer going in the water it helped with flickering issues when wet. They are bright and I get a lot of compliments on how nice they look.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: ***BEWARE*** These are junk
customer_reviews.text: If I could rate these ZERO star I would. Cheap thin plastic! Installed these 3 weeks ago, decided to use my trailer today to haul my 4 wheeler to the dealer for maintenance. Got back home and noticed both light housings were cracked and broke. My advice is to spend a little more and get better quality. Maybe I had a defective set. Amazon is sending me another set! However, I will give another review on the replacement set. #POS
customer_reviews.author: Mflippin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: The light kit was easy to install and worked perfectly on my trailer. I'm so glad to no longer fight with the existing wiring job from the previous owner, nor have to wander each time I connected the trailer if the lights would work or not. I did not use the included wire connectors, instead opting to use heat and solder connectors also bought from Amazon. I would strongly recommend them also for this type of work. The lights are bright and easily visible (road reflections) from the drivers seat of my truck when I'm pulling at night.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding set!!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright as hell first off...Bright. This is a good thing, and they installed super easy although I did not use the included electrical connectors as they are junk but that was already expected. Overall the lights work and mounted great, I have used these several times fully submerged for up to 10mins with no issues whatsoever, BUT please note I unplug my trailer lights before I back into the water its just common sense so I cannot speak on whether they break the laws of physics or not. Overall they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: Should have been 5 star!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this item is 5 star except for the fact that the white ground wire that is supposed to be attached to the tongue of the trailer was way too short to accomplish this. I had to splice a portion of the white wire for the vehicle installation (not required) in order to get sufficient length to attach to the trailer tongue. I attached mine to one of the tongue jack securing bolts as was done on the original installation. The manufacturer should acknowledge this comment and make adjustments to the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nobones Aboutit

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Light assembly and lights are great. Wire up a new trailer and they look great. The wire that comes with the kit is absolute garbage. Less than a year of actual use and exposure to the elements and I'm rewiring the trailer. The wires must be sub par Chinese wire. It's not pure copper! The wire inside the plastic casing has turned to powder!
customer_reviews.author: RDAIV

customer_reviews.title: Great lights
customer_reviews.text: I overhauled my 10 foot trailer. I replaced the old fashioned bulbs lights with these LED ones. They are much brighter and easy to install if your trailer was originally equipped with lights. The wires were all the same color as the old ones and the lights bolted to the existing holes in my trailer. No complaints at all. Very happy with these lights. My trailer is a cargo type so it doesn't go under water and I can't really attest to their waterproof advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Wiring that comes with the kit TURNS TO POWDER
customer_reviews.text: In less than 6 months, the wiring turns to complete powder. Don't know how this is possible, but my lights have stopped working and I'm unable to redo the connections because I cannot strip the wiring without it falling apart in my hand as soon as I try to strip the wiring. unbelievable! now have to rewire the whole trailer to replace this junk wiring. uhg... The lights themselves are fine, but he wiring is complete crap...and I see I'm not alone with this problem with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wire is made of junk
customer_reviews.text: i bought two sets. i installed one of the wire sets. it lasted 1 year and quit working the wire is corroding inside all along the wire. lucky i left the old wires. i had to switch back to them and install a new end from the other set of wires i never installed from the 2nd kit. sure enough the 2ft at the end by the plug was corroding also. i had to go buy a new end from the store to make my awesome lights turn on. the lights work great but the wire it comes with is junk. i suggest not using it to avoid the corrosion of the wire along the entire length.
customer_reviews.author: BelieveMyreview

customer_reviews.title: It may be submersible, but it isn't sealed or waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I got it today. It looks nice. Plenty of parts to do a complete installation. Noticed right away that it wasn't a sealed light. Big gaps between the cover and the housing . I mean, I'm submersible, but as a human I won't last long underwater. This won't either. Also, once I got it all hooked up, it didn't work. At all. None of it. I'm hoping it is just the grounding (I repainted the trailer last weekend, so the paint may be blocking the ground). Will try tomorrow to get it working. Looks nice though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ViViD Can't miss them & that's the whole Point, to be seen
customer_reviews.text: If your trailer needs to be seen then this is the product for you. Easy to install and of good quality & craftsmanship. Packaged with everything necessary for a complete install. I took my old 5'x10' utility trailer out at night after installation and I was so impressed I drove further than I had intended. I highly recommend this product & the affordability of them delivered to my door, awesome. Trailer lighting is required most everywhere I know so for safety's sake please don't spend too much time looking in the mirror at the vivid trail.
customer_reviews.author: Dale T.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF- THIN WIRE
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After 3 months the lights stopped working. Come to find the wire strands are so thin (18guage not 20 guage) they break. Obviously this wire is not of the quality to splice. Had to go out and buy a spool of Hopkins trailer wire which is 16 guage with thick insulation and re wire the entire trailer. Purchased these for a small utility trailer I was rebuilding. The wire harness is very poorly made, very thin gauge wire and the protective wrap is not very tough. All the lights are NOT waterproof. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is because, right now they work and the brightness is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Not submersible!!!!
customer_reviews.text: December 2019 - After my initial install on my boat trailer, I was really impressed. The lights worked great, nice and bright and install went smooth. Fast forward to March 2020 and I realized that some LEDs weren't lighting up. When I looked closely at the lights I realized that both lenses had water in them, not just the housing but the LED lens was flooded. This was after only 6 trips to the boat launch. I also realized that what's pictured is not what I received. The pictures show gaskets on the lights, mine had none. Not impressed and if your looking for boat trailer lights, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: FixitPhil

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice if the side markers were leds (the amber ones ...
customer_reviews.text: very bright well placed leds. Would be nice if the side markers were leds (the amber ones are) but not that important as I very seldom tow at night. well potted so should be good for wet splash but I don"t think I would use them where you would submerge them such as a boat trailer. I had similar ones that were not as well potted and they did not last the season. The wire they included should have been left in china.It is a very small gauge and is very hard to strip (will break so very easily)
customer_reviews.author: TommyB

customer_reviews.title: led lights easy install
customer_reviews.text: for the price i could have bought maybe 2 incandescent replacement lights, this had the wire harness also, so everything i needed to replace my old hacked up harness and broken lights, easy install and the leds work well, i do wish they would include a bracket to mount them to the frame but only because mine have broken off, i used l-brackets from home depot for 1/2 the price drilled a couple holes and mounted them. as far as water it's untested and durability it's a bit soon for that. but the price seemed it was good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Peters

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LIGHTS BUT PREPARE TO GET YOUR OWN HARDWARE.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit. I was really impressed with the quality of the lights. I looked at similar light sets at Walmart and other stores but the value didn't compare to this kit. The only negatives is the electrical hardware isn't very good. I would have rather paid a few extra bucks to get some better electrical connectors, the side markers wont light up and I think is because the plastic connectors are no good and are not making enough contact. Had to make a few quick trips to the local hardware store to get a few things but for the money I feel I saved it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J Norm

customer_reviews.title: Copper inside turned to dust for no reason 6 months ago
customer_reviews.text: Last ones bough lasted 6 months in indiana weather. The copper inside the wires turns to dust and completely fell apart, to the point that they can be snapped with the wrist. Also everything is very rustable, already brown after 6 months. This was on used on a utility trailer, so you would think it would last. Also it came with too few "s" clips ( needs more), and too many blue wire splicers.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Serious Manufacturing DEFECT in harness wire.
customer_reviews.text: The system installed and operated well. My trailer lives outside under a shade tree. Around 6-7 weeks after installation I hooked it up and it failed. On investigation I discovered the harness wiring had disintegrated, inside the plastic coating. I was dust as far back as 6 inches from the light connector. I need a new harness and another saturday morning to install it. What a waste. I haven't tested, but the light fixture wire looked fine and I'm assuming the lights will work once I restore current flow from the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cox

customer_reviews.title: Wire harness is defective and oxidizes to powder in just a few months!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wire with this kit is worthless. Turns to powder inside the the plastic with no contact with elements in less than 6 months. Warranty provides no contact number or information. Amazon needs to investigate this supplier!
customer_reviews.author: Smokey Bear

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights, poor wiring
customer_reviews.text: The lights work great. They are bright. The wiring is horrible. I installed these lights this past April. The right brake/turn light quit working in July. I crawled under the trailer to see what was going on. The green wire had broke. I got checking all the wires and have discovered the insulation on the wires are disintegrating and turning to powder. I can pull the wiring apart with very little effort. This winter I will have to just replace all the wiring (again) from front to back.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great budget trailer lights
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt sure what to expect with cheap LED trailer lights. I needed to replace the wiring on my trailer and figured I may as well get new lights at the same time. I was pleasantly surprised once these were wired up. They worked perfectly and are bright. I used them on my kayak trailer which ive submerged several times and no water has gotten inside the lights. we'll see how long they last but so far im happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Marcus

customer_reviews.title: VERY Brittle
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with these at first and gave them a 3 star rating. I am revising that down to 1 star. Every time these touch anything at all no matter how gently plastic breaks off. These are made out of the cheapest hard plastic you could possibly imagine. Unless you are going to mount your lights inside a steel cage, steer clear of these. I will be reworking the back of my trailer when these fall off to fit different lights.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.MAGA

customer_reviews.title: Garbage wiring harness
customer_reviews.text: Wires are garbage, after less than a year, the entire length of several wires had disentigrated. Not the insulation, the actual wire crumbled into powder. Cheap aluminum wire in a corrosive insulation. Pure junk. Light were bright while they lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Ffjohn

customer_reviews.title: Much brighter than the old 1157 standard bulbs ,
customer_reviews.text: Look people we all know when standard old bulb sistems start giving you problems, take off and throw the hell away. No more crazy bulb replacement, cut fingers with bulbs breaking in your fingers. Longevity,dependability, and you don’t expose your self and others to law inforcement delays and other problems that occur. They are installed on my motorcycle trailer, also on my boat trailer. I have not replaced boat trailer yet. 7years no failure in all weather.!!!👍
customer_reviews.author: Rod B

customer_reviews.title: Great, bright LEDs!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic for LEDS! Super bright. Great price. You will not be disappointed! I bought an extra set for another trailer I have. UPDATE: After 1 year and 1 month, I downgraded to two stars. Two reasons. The right side light stopped working, I've got ground and power, guess the circuit board went out. Another reason, the ground wire just comes apart. You can't even strip the wire without it breaking or strands pulling out. Someone has a video showing this and that is what is happening. A bummer too, because they were so bright and worked well.....for a year and a month....disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James R Russell

customer_reviews.title: Sent 2 left lights
customer_reviews.text: Its a great kit. but after i spend 2 hours wiring up everything i got ready to mount lights and noticed i had 2 lefts..... which is ok except i guess the clear license plate hole on bottom for light is shining up at the sky. i just put black tape on it. would return but dont want to undo everything and pack up, then drive 20 miles to drop off at UPS store. so have to live with it and see how they hold up. other then getting 2 lefts these are bright and work well. easy to install and would buy again (already bought 2)
customer_reviews.author: aussompossum

customer_reviews.title: Super Bright and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Great kit for anyone who wants super bright LED tech upgrade for your trailer cheap. I did not use the generic wire splicers as they usually cause more trouble down the road, instead opting for heat shrinking connections that don't corrode so fast. Gave it a 4 star rating only because wire could be a little thicker then 18gauge although that is the quasi standard. Overall very satisfied with kit and I would recommend to a friend or buy another for myself in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Nice Lights VERY CHEAP WIRE
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you ground everything and I do mean everything or you will just scratch your head. Never had this much of a hassle wiring up lights a 30 minute job ended up taking a couple of hours because the wire was so cheap and couldn't determine where it was broke at so ended up buying some real copper wire and was in no time. The lights them selves are worth the money, well so far anyways...
customer_reviews.author: Gonderoo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product at a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace lights on our Pop-up camper and was surprised at the quality. These are easily half the price of the set I was looking at from a chain store that I wont name (although I will say they have lots of Supply for Tractors) and I feel are just as good quality...if not better. Installation was pretty straightforward, anyone with minimum experience in electrical will be fine, but the directions are laid out for the lay man. Overall i am very happy with the product...will return for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kassi Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, lil skeptical about the plastic plate mount.. thinking about rigging a safety line to plate an steel light mount just in case. Update 4/1/19 just a couple months in service one of the taillights already went out. It not even on a boat trailer... so not submerged ever.... utility trailer use... Buyers beware. 1/23/20 update. All the wire that came in this kit turned to white dust. Rotten from the inside out. Very low quality. Don’t buy this garbage total waste of money. Deserves less then 1 star
customer_reviews.author: OTTO

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a older utility trailer that has broken lights, and the wiring was old. I often had to clean the connections or replace blown bulbs. It was a constant headache every time I went to use the trailer! This trailer light kit fit perfectly with no modifications, and came with more than enough good quality wire to get everything connected on my 5x10 utility trailer. The price was extremely reasonable, and the LED lights are bright.
customer_reviews.author: jeffs3g

customer_reviews.title: Compete set to replace trailer lights.
customer_reviews.text: Everything needed to replace trailer lights in this set. Only wish the wires were a bit longer - short for my 16 ft trailer by 2 ft. Also wish they would include some wire clips to attach wire to frame of trailer. Also make sure you have a great ground - will make a difference in brightness and for the lights to completely work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK product, two issues to know about. Not fully LED, no mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.text: Product is fairly nice, and works. Two issues to be aware of, dropping one star for each. 1) These are not all LED. the side marker light on the main red taillights, not the amber marker, is a regular bulb. One burned out on me already after minimal use. I'm a bit unhappy since I specifically purchased LED. 2) there are no mounting brackets for the tail lights. Unless you are bolting to a flat surface, facing backwards, you will have to fabricate brackets. I suspect many of these are bolted to the sides of a trailer, if so many will need to fabricate their own bracket.
customer_reviews.author: techie

customer_reviews.title: Durability & wire corrosion issues
customer_reviews.text: Plastic signals are brittle. Worse, the wiring is failing because the wires are corroding inside the insulation and breaking. It appears that the wire gauge is minimal and when stripped now has corrosion “powder” on wires. Trailer has never been in water and only been mounted and out of packaging about six weeks. Maybe I got a bad batch. The price seemed reasonable. Components looked okay. Durability’s the issue. I will have to replace harness.
customer_reviews.author: senior adult user#2

customer_reviews.title: a good trailer kit
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a good trailer kit. If you can't stand the red side markers being regular bulbs(yea I don't know why), just move along and find some which cost a little more for all LEDs. Anyhow, the parts came in fine, installation instructions are easy to read and follow as long as you know basic wiring. My only dislikes are that the light's ground wires have no loop connectors on them, I had to buy some. Plus the light wires could be a little longer which would facilitate in finding a good spot for them, especially for the ground wires. Other than that, they are good and bright lights.
customer_reviews.author: John k

customer_reviews.title: Lights are OK, DON'T USE THE WIRING!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't see, or glossed over, previous reviews that talked about the wires turning to dust (not to mention the plastic turning to goo). It has only been three months, and I have to replace all the wiring. I can't even strip the wires to redo the corroded connections. The funny thing is that, at this price, just the lights would be a decent deal, and then I would have given it a four or five stars. The wire to the lights seems OK, its just the wiring harness that sucks doggy doo. The wire is sort of a freebee, but it completely backfired because it causes the owner to have to redo all the trailer wiring. WOW!
customer_reviews.author: FixItDan

customer_reviews.title: Wiring turns to powder.
customer_reviews.text: Had this kit for less than a year before the wiring failed. When I started to look into why the lights stopped working, I found that the wires had turned to a powder. DO NOT BUY THIS KIT!!!! Now I have to find a kit with better wiring, and do the whole thing over again.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cosby

customer_reviews.title: Led lights are the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Rebuilt a boat trailer and this "set" was perfect for the job. I solder rather than use those stupid piercing clips for connections. Shrink wrap and tape . It will last years. What you do is tape the new wires to the old ones and pull them through the tubing of the trailer like "snaking" wires through walls.
customer_reviews.author: bumperhead_1951

customer_reviews.title: All LED and sealed wiring...
customer_reviews.text: These are all LED. After reading some of the reviews I was expecting incandescent sidelights in the brakelights but they are all LED. The light housing is not sealed but the wiring on the inside is sealed in something like an epoxy. There was a small section of bare wire not covered up by the epoxy so I put some jbweld on it. These are nice waterproof lights and I was happy to see the wiring was waterproofed.
customer_reviews.author: Saul T. Krue

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wiring but look good when set up.
customer_reviews.text: Installed them January 2018. Wires are a really thin blend of angel-hair copper (?) and break fairly easy once the jacket is removed for connecting. My ground wire broke with the first use. So not sure how long they will last, but they look great when lit up. I didn't use the side marker lights since mine were still in good shape AND these have 2 mounting screws rather se again than the normal 1 screw. I sure didn't want to drill more holes in my thick aluminum trailer. If they last they are a good deal. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: metal maven

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 2 hours to install. Did a proper install like the manufacturer when running the cables. Pretty seem less install and detailed instructions. Make sure you properly ground each light fixture. If it's not working and your sure your hooked it up check the grounding first! So far so good. Lights are bright and working as described. Can't go wrong with the price either! Disregard the comments about the wiring turning into powder. Haven't experienced that.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt of Marines

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: I noticed right away just how thin the material is that the housings are cast from. When tightening the nuts that retain the housings to the trailer the first housing cracked. No . I did not over tighten the nut. The second fared no better. After reinforcing the housings with chryo glue and pvc sheet stock i managed to get a working set of lights that won't fall off the trailer after a light shock. I would not recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon faulty Wiring plug
customer_reviews.text: Routed Wiring through Trailer Frame and right Turn signal didn't work! thought it may have been my fault and removed wiring for a closer inspection! No damage! With wiring end close enough I checked for continuity! 0 Ohms! Piercing the wire just on the other side of the Plug to the Plug connector 0 Ohms! Faulty Plug! What a waste of my Time! Next time I will check everything before installing it! I would not what anyone to go through what I had to!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant at all
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in December2019, got around to putting them on my trailer in April 2020. My boat has been to the water three times since, the first two times I don't believe the lights got in the water, they did yesterday. One has water in it and quit working. These are not submersible as indicated in the ad.
customer_reviews.author: roadster

customer_reviews.title: Great and Bright lights - Missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: This light kit is good. Would be great if it had all the necessary parts to complete installation. Taillights are LED as advertised and are bright. Sidelights are not LED but are good. Would have preferred the sidelights to be LED as well. As I mentioned earlier, missing hardware but mentioned in the directions include eyelets for grounding sidelights as well as self tapping screws for grounding both sidelights and taillights. Luckily I had this hardware available in my garage and it didn’t require a trip to the hardware store. Would have given it 5 stars absent missing hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: First the good. These lights are bright and seem to be ...
customer_reviews.text: First the good. These lights are bright and seem to be built well. They fit my trailer perfectly and had all necessary hardware for installation. Now the bad. The wire included in the kit for the vehicle and the trailer is thinner than I've seen before for this application. I understand that LED lights use less wattage and therefore a smaller diameter wire can be used. But this wire has no strength for an application that requires some physical resilience. Twice the wire was completely cut during installation by the quick splice connectors included in the kit. I am skeptical about how the wire will hold up during use.
customer_reviews.author: wishinIwasfishin

customer_reviews.title: Very poor wire quality!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this light setup on a new trailer in May, and went to Key West. All worked fine. Used it in July to pick up a zero turn mower, and again all was fine. Went to use it Wednesday, and the tail lights and brake lights were inop. Checked and found no power to either stop/tail lamp assy. Further diagnosis showed the wires in then harness deteriorated to nothing. I tried stripping the insulation and there was no copper wire to be found. I had to replace the 4 pin connector and all wiring back to the stop/tail lamp assemblies. The lights all appear good, but the harness is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Dragracer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Initially after installing it I would likely give a good review....however after about 5 uses of the trailer one of the back tail light totally failed. It was the LED itself not a connection. I soldered all connections. Then at the connection harness to connect to the car one of the contacts failed...so I endured flickering lights until I could repair the trailer portion of the connecting harness. The 15 year old auto portion of the harness was still good!
customer_reviews.author: Jon R.

customer_reviews.title: Trash!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and was pleased with the packaging and the overall looks but after installing and testing the tail lights didn’t work at all, side markers worked but were extremely dim. I spent 2 days troubleshooting making sure it wasn’t my truck or the wiring that it came with. I tried different methods of connection As well as the offered wire nuts(if these are submersible why would you use wire nuts?). Overall my conclusion is the taillights simply do not work. I reached out to maxxhauls customer service and no reply after 4 days. I’m giving up on this trash. Returning and gonna try CZC which has some decent reviews
customer_reviews.author: Timothy & Kiersten

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my small 5x10 trailer in hopes it would last me for a long time. I used GOOD, shielded, crimp connectors. I used dielectric grease on them and even shrink wrapped them to help protect the connection. I bought them May 30th and by Aug/Sept I noticed one broken wire. Few weeks after that I noticed the whole wire on the opposite side is parted. I tried to re-splice and add new connectors but it literally falls apart in your hand. I can pull on it with my finger and it breaks apart. It's just complete junk wire and evidently not UV rated. I'm guessing that's the issue since it fell apart so quickly ?
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Buy for lights; get wiring elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: The lights are nice, sealed in epoxy inside the red globe. The wiring and harness are very cheap and mine malfunctioned. The wire is less than audio wire; the conduit very soft. My flat four blade had some power leakage between left signal and running lights. I ended up buying Hopkins wiring and all was great after that. Buy for lights, but your cost will double because their wire is very cheap and subject to fail. I could strip it with fingernails. The individual runs for turn or tail light wouldn't separate without copper being exposed. Good light. Subpar wiring.
customer_reviews.author: American Consumer

customer_reviews.title: you'll be replacing it again in six months
customer_reviews.text: I installed this product one of my trailers in February 2019. The end of the wires near the lights up by the vehicle plug was corroded to the point that they literally fell apart in my hand by August 2019. I found powder in the insulation where the wires should be for three feet before giving up on finding usable wire and ended up replacing the whole setup. I installed this kit with heat shrink at all terminal connections and the majority of the wires were in a tube that runs along the frame so this product should have lasted for a lot longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Dewell J Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and the" Partsam Red Clearance ID BAR Marker Light 3 Light 9 LED Trailer Sealed Stainless Steel" I rewired my whole fishing boat trailer on a whim. It went flawless, even though as i was plugging it in I said, "Something is not going to work" Well everything went flawless. If I ever have to replace a set of lights again this is where I am coming. I'll tell you what, going from regular lights to LED is a huge improvement. you will love these lights. The price was awesome also.
customer_reviews.author: Bics

customer_reviews.title: Buy LED lights but the outer bulbs are filament and ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy LED lights but the outer bulbs are filament and not LED. Kinda cheesy I suppose but they were inexpensive. I replaced the filament bulb with LED's I had. EDIT: I would like to update this review. I've used the trailer twice since buying these lights and got pulled over today for no brake lights. They are dead. No longer work. The officer was nice and didn't hassle me so I ran to Wal-Mart and grabbed a cheap set of lights and spliced them into my harness on the trailer to get home. I would not recommend these lights.
customer_reviews.author: raidmagic

customer_reviews.title: Crap wiring
customer_reviews.text: Everything hooked up OK, worked first time. Came back to use trailer few weeks later, no lights. Source plug checked OK. Tested ground wire on tailer, no continuity. Tried to fix, connector broke off, so tried to cut back the wire cover, the wire broke up, turns out the wire is corroded and brittle all the back to the plug. Hey, the lights may work, but the wiring is utter cheap crap and will let you down. I'm going to have to re-wire the plug and ground at very least. Don't fall for the low price, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: C Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Terrible wire quality!!
customer_reviews.text: This kit was convenient but the wire is junk. I've had my kit for less than a year, installed on the trailer. I used heatshrink connectors on every connection, and did everything I could to prevent corrosion. This is a utility trailer, and as such doesn't get submerged. You would think I put the entire trailer in the ocean for a year. The wire is literally breaking off in pieces anywhere I touch it. I am very disappointed that I am going to have to rewire the entire trailer yet again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Garner

customer_reviews.title: Not submersible
customer_reviews.text: Submersible........ I always unplug my trailer lights when launching my boat just incase the lights aren’t sealed. The first time using the trailer after installing these lights, half the lights stopped working when I plugged them back in after loading the boat. The led lights that stopped working were where the water hadn’t drained out yet (if truly submersible this shouldn’t have been an issue). So now I only have half a light on each side. Very aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Submersible???
customer_reviews.text: I was initially disappointed in these after looking at the holes in the outer casing. After opening the assembly, I visually saw that the LED lights are encased in a sealed disc. I've tested them on my trailer, launching my boat over 5 times now, with no issues. As far as the wiring quality, the wire shipped to my was just fine. I used it to rewire the trailer and had no issues. Although there's nothing exceedingly exceptional about this product, I'm giving this a five star as it did exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: shoez03

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for quality
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to other reviews the unit I got has fixed all of the complaints. The side markers are LED. Good quality wires. It doesn't state that it is waterproof but it sure looks like it is. I took the unit apart because I was going to seal it with silicone but realized I didn't need to because all the components are embedded in some kind of epoxy and should be waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: J. Salvino

customer_reviews.title: Taillights stopped working properly after one submersion.
customer_reviews.text: Installed them. They looked great. Worked fine in the driveway and without exposure to water. The rear taillights failed after only one use on my pwc trailer. I returned them, and installed a new replacement set that was sent to me. Looked great in the driveway. This second set failed after only two pwc launchings. Total waste of my time and money. I should have read some of the other reviews before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Steffanetta

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Price
customer_reviews.text: Work great (as advertised) The price / value is a bargain (even without the wiring kit) These lights are plenty bright. Replaced my old (OEM) trailer lights with these, I was tired of messing with the old 1157 bulbs. Some reviews state the wiring breaks down, all wiring on my trailer is inside conduit (not exposed to sunlight). I used some of the "new wire" (in the kit) for the amber marker lights (Leds) we'll see how it performs over time, it too is in conduit.
customer_reviews.author: Grampy

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. (as are most trailer light kits) I have ordered 2 of these kits now for 2 different trailers, and am debating ordering a third to replace the existing lights on my other boat trailer. They don't short out when submerged, and they look great against my fresh painted trailers. Night time visibility is a plus as well. They're just as bright as my truck lights. For 25 bucks, there's not a better light kit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fisher

customer_reviews.title: JUNK. DO NIT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of crap! I lost $350 in labor charges so far. I installed the wiring, all worked fine. A few months later 1 light was out. Took it to shop. 6 hrs labor later chasing corroded rotten wires. It would have been cheaper to have them re-wire it. And the pet that sucks even more is there is still more wire that is bound to go bad!!! More $$$ out of my pocket. DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK. Class action law suit.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of trailer lights.
customer_reviews.text: Comes with everything you need, although I spliced the short white wire and ran it to the lights instead of just grounding it and the lights. Have been through a couple of strong rains and still going strong. I have not submerged them. Nice and bright like most LEDs are.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Fit and worked great :)
customer_reviews.text: Best thing for solving my never working trailer lights ! Spent hours working on the old non led lights ;( Mainly because of an intermittent ground) Changed all the lights and wiring plus added an extra ground to the rear lights. TIP..if you have a folding trailer, run the ground wires from the front harness to the rear lights grounds rather than just bolt them to the trailer. They will work perfectly :)
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M.

customer_reviews.title: tail lights good, wiring BAD
customer_reviews.text: Bought twice in August and September 2019. First set great. Second set was not used until April 2020. Wiring was so thin, it could not be stripped. Tried three differant style wiring strippers and a knife. I could not see the wire in the casing. Had to use my own wiring. Trashed wiring from kit.
customer_reviews.author: mark b

customer_reviews.title: Lights are great... wiring is cheap
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in August of 2018 on my 8' utility trailer. After 6 months the wires have become extremely brittle. My ground wire broke and is so brittle I cannot even strip the insulation off without it breaking. I can use my fingernail and break the wires into two pieces. Giving these two stars because the lights themselves seem to be just fine. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT use the included wire harness!
customer_reviews.author: DBAKK

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement when you back into something
customer_reviews.text: My wife was guiding me. so i hit a pole. oops. these are cheap replacement that update to led. on a trailer for RZR, so dont back into water, so cant comment on waterproof-ness, but easy to install. all the holes line up on standard trailers and look great!
customer_reviews.author: W Sac Ca

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation with minimal tools
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation with minimal tools I put these lights on a homemade kayak trailer. I can’t comment on the water resistance since I probably won’t be putting the trailer in the water. The instructions are easy to follow, it took me about 20 minutes to wire up the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: LKGLAKEBOY

customer_reviews.title: Poor wire quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the wiring harness is very poor. After less than a year, of very little use the wiring is failing. The wire is very thin and the quality of the insulation for the wire is also poor. You get what you pay for. Don't waste your time with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Excellent company.
customer_reviews.text: The wiring and lights are exactly what I needed. They are Really bright! I did not use any of the hardware as my trailer has channels to run wire. Contacted the company with a problem and they responded perfectly by sending me a new component in the mail. No question no problem. It seems the company upgraded the wire to copper, which is depicted on Youtube. So those reviewers who got aluminum wiring must have gotten an old product. Very satisfied with the product and customer service. Could not ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Mass buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good lights, not so good wiring (Marine)
customer_reviews.text: These lights work well and are pretty bright. The downside is the wiring. First off, don’t mess up when wiring them as there isn’t much excess wire to work with. Secondly, I’ve had these on a boat trailer for a year now and all of the wires corroded out and turned to dust. I’d imagine on a non submersible trailer they would be okay but not for a boat unless you shrink wrap the wires. For the price they aren’t bad but keep in mind the possible frequent replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Beware of wiring
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a 1/2 a year now. the light is working fine, but I am really unhappy with the wiring. So some squirrels ate the connector off, so I tried replacing the connector with a new one. when I tried stripping the stock wire to make a connection, the wire only would break on me. No matter how many times I tried,(20) it would just break. Which means that the wiring had already corroded, became/ rotten, after a short time. I guess the saying of getting what you pay for, is really true in this instance.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: wiring doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: install was easy ... haven't submerged in water but has resisted rain update: after approx. 1 year from installation and 1 use (not water related), the wiring harness has completely corroded from the inside. all wires in the harness have become dust inside the plastic sheathing. the wires on the lights themselves have remained solid, so leaving it at 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Bill W.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the lights but not with the wiring.
customer_reviews.text: For the price its a good deal. The lights work great so far. ( couple of weeks old) the harness is plenty long for my trailer. Only thing is the connector to truck (flat 4 prong) is really cheap feeling. Tried to use it but it would not make good contact. Used the old one from the original trailer harness. The wire itself feels cheap, but it works fine. So.....plan on maybe having to get another connector and also get some butt/barrel connectors to make connections.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Use These As Submersible Lights on Boat Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights as a replacement for my boat trailer. Thought as they were submersible I would mount them low on the trailer, since my old lights were mounted high up, and very often bumped my head against them. After the second time I launched my boat the left hand indicator or turn signal only has half the LEDs working. I'm thinking the more I launch the more issues are going to turn up. Submersible they are not in my books! If I had to do it again either mount them high out of the water or purchase better quality true and trusted submersible lights.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Crappy customer support!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product was ok. The reason for a 1 star is, i had a broken reflector that i did. I sent them 3 emails asking for a part number and cost and never received a word. If they dont respond to something that simple, i am sure they wont with the harder ones
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product. The wire is very small gauge
customer_reviews.text: Very poor product. The wire is very small gauge, I don't expect long life of the wire. I had to replace a defective connector after the first use. The LEDs on the left brake light went out before the first trip was completed. They light very dimly, although the tail light LED's still work. You will be much happier if you buy a higher quality set of lights, for slightly more money.
customer_reviews.author: Les Hildenbrandt

customer_reviews.title: Good LED Lights
customer_reviews.text: Nice LED Lights, came with everything needs to install on my trailer that had broken tail lights on it at the time, these mounted perfectly on to the existing mounting brackets. They are very bright, look to be water proof enough (but this is a mower trailer I am using them on).
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Do not use the included wire!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to write a review, its been over a year since I installed my kit, however, recently I've had a LOT of problems with the included wire. The lights work fine, however the wire that came with the kit is absolute junk. After about 9 months, the wire has corroded internally, and now the entire harness requires replacement. If you do use this kit, please buy wire from a different source. I've not had a single problem with the lights, although I just recently figured out the parking lights inside the tail lights use incandescent bulbs, not LED. Only the orange parking lights and the tail/brake lights are led. You definitely get what you pay for with this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hall

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Not for use on a boat trailer. After only one year the wire is deteriorating and one sealed light has water in it. I now have to replace the lights and re-wire the trailer. Like others have said, the wire actually turned to powder
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lights seem ok. Nothing special.  Connector is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I install new trailer lights every 1-2 years. I live in coastal South Carolina and launch my boat in saltwater. I've yet to find trailer lights that can stand up to that. We'll see how these do. My complaint about this product is the connector. I'm referring to the connector on the end of the wiring harness that attaches the wiring to the truck. It is cheap and loose. After installing I tested the lights and they didn't work. Jiggling the connector gets them to work. I will have to cut the connector off my old trailer light harness and splice it to the harness. I'll throw away the cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Lights worked great but the wiring didn't last even a year. might have been less than 6 months. Wire breaks apart inside the insulation. I tried to repair the crappy part and couldn't even touch it with my stripper without it crumbling.
customer_reviews.author: headstrong

customer_reviews.title: Lights work, wire didn't
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my pontoon trailer a few months ago and about a month ago the lights stared fading and not working. I'm a pretty good electrician. So when I went to snooping to find the problem I found it was the wire itself., it had disintegrated and turn into white chalky powder. Needless to say I ordered a new wiring harness from a different seller and I hope everything is going to work great this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof
customer_reviews.text: one of my lights filled with water and failed. otherwise the installation was easy, and they are nice and bright etc. but now I've only got one... the other seemed to stay water proof (for now). So, if you're mounting them on a non-boat trailer, i think they would be excellent. but if you back your trailer into the water. you're going to want something else that is actually sealed. Which is what i guess I need to do.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Lights do not work with headlights turned on
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a rookie at wiring trailers but this kit is absolute junk! I've wasted an entire day running down gremlins with the lights. The blinkers work, the brake lights work, the side marker on the lights work, but for the life of me, I cannot get the rear lights to work with my truck's headlights turned on. I'm going to end up shipping this POS back and looking elsewhere. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: ajc1969

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a cheap fix for my harbor freight trailer. Worked well. I used heat shrink instead of the wire nuts which will help protect the wire. Didn't come with many of the wire hangers but I was able to reuse some of the old ones. All bulbs need to be grounded. Used a meter to take sure all grounds where good.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo

customer_reviews.title: Bright clear light
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version with light bulbs and find this product a big improvement. Clean clear and crisp light and easy to install. Attaching the plastic license plate holder was a bit tricky but I’m happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for everything you need.
customer_reviews.text: This kit appears to be the equivalent of kits costing considerably more at the big box stores, and it works really well when installed. The LED lights are considerably brighter than conventional lights. I am using this kit on a 5 x 8 utility trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: MaxxHaul 70205 12V All LED Submersible Trailer Light Kit
product_meta.description: Maxxtow trailer light kits are built to meet or exceed DOT standards. Light kits are for trailers under 80 inches in width. Light kits (non magnetic) include 2 stop/tail/turn lights, 2 side marker lights, wiring harness and mounting hardware.
feature_bullets: Kit includes stop, tail and turn signal lights, two amber clearance lights and wiring harness
Includes 23 and 4 foot 4-pole color coded wiring harness. Product Type: Lighting and Electrical
High visibility LED taillights last longer than standard incandescent lights
Complies with DOT standards; Side lens are with standard bulb. Corrosion resistant housing. For trailers less than 80 Inch wide
Includes 23-foot wiring harness with UV coated jackets

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,272 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
